benchmark_details.name: TOOLRET (Tool Retrieval Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: TOOLRET is a comprehensive benchmark for tool retrieval tasks, designed to evaluate information retrieval models in selecting relevant tools from a large corpus of tools for large language models (LLMs). It includes 7.6k diverse retrieval tasks and a corpus of 43k tools.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of TOOLRET is to systematically evaluate the performance of various information retrieval models on tool retrieval tasks to improve LLM capabilities in practical applications.

data.source: TOOLRET benchmark integrates tasks and tools collected from existing datasets, public research papers, and open-source platforms.
data.annotation: Manually annotated by experts and includes diverse task scenarios and tool descriptions.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the relevance of retrieved tools and their alignment with the input queries.
methodology.interpretation: Higher NDCG, precision, and recall indicate better retrieval performance, reflecting the effectiveness of the information retrieval models.
methodology.baseline_results: The best-performing model achieved NDCG@10 of 33.83, showcasing significant challenges in tool retrieval tasks.
methodology.validation: Validated through performance comparison with existing IR models and human expert review.

harm: Poor retrieval may lead to ineffective tool-use LLM performances.
